item.title: Culture
item.description: The MoMa The NYC Museum of Modern Art, situated in Middle Manhattan, opened in 1929 at the instigation of two ladies, Mrs Abby Aldrich Rockefeller and Mary Quinn Sullivan. It was the first museum dedicated to modern art in the USA back then. Little by little, the Moma gained international prominence by organising successful exhibitions of artists like Picasso, Edward Hopper, Whistler, Rothko, Walker Evans or Native American artists. It has now a very rich permanent collection of more than 200,000 works of modern and contemporary art.

item.title: Introduction
item.description: Talk shows: Information or Entertainement? Summary.pdf Summary Talk shows are an important feature of the US media landscape. They have established themselves as a legitimate source of information. Talk shows are not easily categorised because even the ones that position themselves primarily as comedy (late-night comedy shows) are also important forums of political discourse. Politically oriented talk shows are also dominated by prime time political analysis programming.

item.title: Trailerb
item.description: The Pentagon Papers were top secret documents about US political and military involvment in Vietnam from 1945 to 1967. They were leaked to newspapers in 1971 and revealed that the US government had not been honest and that decisions about the Vietnam war had been made without the consent of congress.

item.title: Trailera
item.description: The Watergate scandal started when the Nixon administration tried to cover up a break-in at the Democratic National Comittee's office in 1972. The robbery took place at the Watergate complex in Washington, D.C. The burglary and other illegal acts were exposed in investigations carried out by the media with the help of a mysterious informant, "Deep Throat". In the end, the scandal caused President Richard Nixon to resign.
